titlestmt.titleproper: Inventory of the Ernest Cecil Deane letters
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Hoover Institution Archives Staff

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2017-04-10T16:43-0700
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid is written in English

change.item: Revised to add microfilm reel descriptions from microfilm cabinet inventory by Liz Phillips.

did.abstract: Relates to Allied military activities during World War II and the Nuremberg trials.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Ernest Cecil Deane letters, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1981.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

originalsloc.head: Location of Originals
originalsloc.p: Originals in possession of: E. C. Deane.

altformavail.head: Location of Copies
altformavail.p: Duplicate microfilm in: Arkansas History Commission.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Lieutenant colonel, United States Army; public relations officer attached to Supreme Headquarters, Allied Expeditionary Forces, 1943-1944, Third Army Headquarters, 1944-1945, and Nuremberg Military District, 1945-1946.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Relates to Allied military activities during World War II and the Nuremberg trials.

controlaccess.subject: Nuremberg Trial of Major German War Criminals, Nuremberg, Germany, 1945-1946.
World War, 1939-1945--Campaigns--Western Front.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes 312 letters between Deane and his wife and Uncle Walt; many letters are V-mail format.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains 203 letters to Deane's parents, including telegrams and letters in V-mail format.
